name: places/ChIJ4cOyTqVbwokRVF_h80Ww1dE
formattedAddress: 73 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 73 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: I had the take out bbq shrimp & white  rice ($12). It was delicious and healthy. It is very tough to find parking near by is the only negative about the location I didn't like. Very friendly and fast service. I would definitely go here again.

text.text: I had the take out bbq shrimp & white  rice ($12). It was delicious and healthy. It is very tough to find parking near by is the only negative about the location I didn't like. Very friendly and fast service. I would definitely go here again.

originalText.text: The BBQ beef & shrimp in lemon grass sauce are both good. Don’t understand why it has such a low rating. The rating should be at least 4+.

text.text: The BBQ beef & shrimp in lemon grass sauce are both good. Don’t understand why it has such a low rating. The rating should be at least 4+.

originalText.text:
I’m traveling from Florida and I’m also a server so maybe my standard of ‘good’ hospitality is a little different but I felt very discriminated here. They visited the tables with wealthy, older gentlemen 3-4 times before they ever came to ours. We flagged a worker down, who I believe is the male owner, who rolled his eyes at us for asking for a straw. We waited a while after finishing our food, when he came to take our bowls. Even then, we sat there with an empty table and we started to get up, when they told us to remain seated and that they would bring the check to us. After delivering it and we had put our payment inside, they just would take their sweet time until coming by.

For a place that’s obviously so focused on getting people in and out, that lacks genuine care for the customer, at least focus on closing tables too!!!

I can definitely tell the young female server (daughter?) and the female owner lady are genuinely nice people but in my honest opinion, running a restaurant business is more than just being fast or being ‘nice’. You have to make customers feel welcomed and cared for. That includes AT LEAST visiting a table for more than just taking their order

originalText.text: I came here with some colleagues for lunch and the food was excellent. We started off with some spring rolls which were very tasty and perfectly crisped. I ordered the Pho which was rich, filled with an abundance of meat and given in a large portion. My colleague ordered the pork chop over rice with shredded pork and she said it was perfectly charred and very flavorful. Overall, the food was great and the service was quick. As we were finishing up we saw that the table next to us had ordered something very fragrant. We asked the waiter what it was and she said it was the soft shell crab. Planning to come back later this week and try it!

originalText.text: I have been to this restaurant on many occasions, but last Saturday (10/26/19) was the first time were I have been very poorly treated in a restaurant. I came in with my family and I asked for a table for 9 persons, I was seated. Then, I waited like 15 to 20 minutes for the menu until I called a young girl (the waiter) and requested the menu. She gave it to us and didn't bother to ask if we needed anything to drink while we decided on the menu. Then we waited like another 20 minutes until I called her again and told her that we were waiting a long time for someone to take our order. She then proceeded in a rude manner to tell us that if we were ready we were supposed to call her to order (first time I hear this from any restaurant, in other places the waiter approaches the table to take  order). A family member proceeded to ask if a particular platter contained mushrooms as she is allergic to them, the waiter said that it didn't, so she ordered the platter. When the food came it did contained mushrooms and when we called the waiter she started arguing with us about it instead of trying to solve the situation - allergy to certain foods is a very serious matter. In short, I would think about it twice to go to this place. I loved the food, but definitely dislike the service.
